page.title: 07EDUCATION IN WANSFORD AREA
page.content: From our questionnaire we discovered that 42% of the households had children. 6% went to playgroup, 27% went to primary school and the remaining 57% attended secondary school. The most popular primary school is at Nassington and the most popular secondary school is Stamford High. The average distance the children had to travel to school each day is 14 miles there and back. The furthest distance a child had to travel is 76 miles both ways, and the shortest was 3. 60% of the children use the school bus and 40% went to school through private transport. Most people would like a primary school in Wansford although felt that a secondary school is unnecessary.
